page.title: 06LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: In the Doomsday Book, the village of Pathcham was recorded under the name of Piceamor Pacceham Amor _ a small place to love.There were only 26 houses in the village! {ALL SAINTS' CHURCH}:A Church stood here before 1086; much of the present building dates from the early 12th century.The Nave and Chancel are Norman.The 'Doom' painting over the arch is probably late 12th Century and was uncovered in 1883 under 30 coats of whitewash.In the Churchyard the oldest tomb is that of Mary Gunn (1694).A famous smuggler,Daniel Skayles is buried by the North wall.He was shot in 1796 nearby. {TITHE BARN _}this long barn is said to be the longest in Sussex.It is on the North side of the Church. {
